body.name: Seventh Generation Concentrated Laundry Detergent, Stain Fighting Formula, Fresh Lavender scent, 40 oz (53 Loads)

climatePledgeFriendly.details: U.S. EPA Safer Choice certified products contain safer ingredients for human health and the environment.

features: Powerful triple-enzyme formula fights tough stains
Fresh Lavender Detergent is gently scented with 100% essential oils and botanical extracts
Concentrated detergent washes 53 medium loads in a high efficiency (HE) or standard machine
USDA Certified Biobased Product 96% made with plant-based ingredients
Shipment contains one 40oz bottle with 53 loads
body.description: Powerfully clean and wonderfully scented – just the way Mother Nature intended. Seventh Generation Sparkling Seaside Concentrated Liquid Laundry Detergent features a triple-enzyme formula that fights tough stains without the use of synthetic fragrances, dyes, or artificial brighteners. This laundry soap uses plant-derived enzyme stain removers like Protease and Amylase to tackle all of life’s messes. We like to keep it real when it comes to scents, too. Fresh Lavender Laundry Detergent is gently scented with 100% essential oils and botanical extracts. Our ultra-concentrated laundry soap uses less added water, allowing us to use a smaller bottle to deliver impressive cleaning power – 53 loads in a 40 oz. container. Good things really do come in small packages. For more than 25 years, Seventh Generation has been thoughtfully formulating safe and effective plant-based products that work. Really well. As a leading green laundry detergent manufacturer, we are proud to make biodegradable detergents made with plant-based ingredients. You may also notice a cute Leaping Bunny seal on our products. That means we never test our products on animals and our products do not contain animal-based ingredients. We design our products to be safe for people, their homes, and the environment. Based in Vermont, Seventh Generation is proud to be a Certified B Corporation. B Corps are certified to be better for workers, better for communities, and better for the environment. By choosing Seventh Generation products, you’re joining us in nurturing the health of the next seven generations.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gentle Care for Sensitive Skin - Seventh Generation Laundry
reviews.reviewText: Seventh Generation Concentrated Laundry Detergent in Free & Clear Fragrance-Free has become my go-to solution for laundry care as someone with sensitive skin prone to eczema. Its gentle, hypoallergenic formula ensures a fragrance-free and irritation-free laundry experience, proving effective in cleaning clothes without compromising on skin health. The concentrated nature of the detergent not only enhances its cleaning power but also makes it an economical choice. The eco-friendly packaging aligns with my sustainability values, although a slightly more user-friendly cap would be appreciated. Overall, this detergent has significantly improved my laundry routine, providing a perfect balance of effectiveness and gentleness for my sensitive skin.

reviews.reviewText: Bought to wash our dog's plushies. The scent is nice, it gets the toys clean, and it is safe for my dog - a win win win!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Smells wonderful,clean and gentle on my clothes while making them very clean

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It’s good enough to use, and it’s of nice quality, but I won’t be buying it again. It doesn’t feel like it’s too much better than other brands. It’s a cute little bottle.I HATE the packaging through. It is just an open lid, so when you unscrew it or screw it back on, the leftover soap drips out from the seal. It’s super messy. I’d expect the packaging to be much better.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great laundry soap
reviews.reviewText: Love this laundry soap!! Eco friendly!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this Detergent 🧼
reviews.reviewText: I see a lot of bad reviews stating hatred of the new cap. I don’t have that issue , I save a cap from a dead bottle, and use it for future loads. I like to use Method’s caps because I feel as though the caps 1st gen have are too large for my loads. My mother would use a plastic measuring cup when I was growing up. Either way I actually like the new spout, it pours better and with less spillage in my opinion. I have more control with this bottle, but I have a hand that’s double jointed and I get frustrated with the other bottles shapes. This must mean this bottle is very annoying to people with normal bend-one-way fingers. I agree that the bottle should be changed so spillage hole will catch excess liquid, that is common sense.I love the scent so much, the non-concentrated kind had a lavender I am not into, very wild flower type. The concentrated kind smells like Bulgarian type of lavender that is amazing. I am thinking to try the one pour spout, it seems like more bang for your buck and claims to be the same scent. I use like 6 different soaps combined in my wash, but this is the main soap I use for scent and power. I also have to hand wash most of my clothes, so that makes a difference in type of soap I choose as well.Gets every stain out (along with my other choices) my girl works at a mechanic shop and this soap is completely necessary in my get-it-clean system. We also have two completely different scent needs for our bodies, I am woodsy she is sweet, and as women this is a great base scent for every kind of cologne, perfume, essential oil , lotion, or hair stuff we use. Enjoy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars gentle yet powerful
reviews.reviewText: The concentrated formula ensures effective stain removal while being mindful of the environment. The absence of synthetic fragrances and dyes aligns with Seventh Generation's commitment to a healthier and greener cleaning alternative.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I grew up with my mom using the Seventh Generation brand and I never had a skin irritation to it. Now that I'm married, I wanted to figure out what brand would work for us throughout our own home. I wanted a detergent that smelt good, cleaned the laundry ( of course ), didn't cause skin irritation, less chemicals, etc.My husband works almost 12 hour days as a landscaper and he works out in the sun. He comes home dirty, covered with grass, and soaked with sweat. The only bone that I have to pick with this detergent is that it doesn't get the smell out of his clothes and sometimes they don't look the cleanest it could. So I switched detergents.This is probably just my experience. If your husband doesn't work outside, I recommend this detergent.

Our family has been using this detergent for several years and it's our favorite. I have tried so many other ones and they all had one thing wrong with them, scent, a film, toughness, etc. This one has been perfect, no weird detergent film, nice and soft after wash and zero scent but our clothes are so clean and smell fresh and natural like cotton. It's also not to bad with stains and has kept our clothes in great condition while other competitors left our clothes with wash wear and discoloration. My only minor complaint is they changed their lid and I hate it, it leaks horribly. I ended up asking the company why they changed it and it was due to manufactures not producing it anymore because of the pandemic and rising costs. They also sent me a coupon to use for my troubles which they didn't have to. I ended up keeping my old bottle and just refill it so I don't have to worry about the cap leaking or getting sticky.I usually purchase this at my local grocery store but sometimes they sell out, it's nice that Amazon carries it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for sensitive skin and smells like heaven
reviews.reviewText: Best for sensitive skin. I struggled for years to find a detergent that didn't irritate my skin. Bonus that this is scented and still so amazing for sensitive skin.

I would usually get whichever detergent I can find in stores however I noticed that I am always itchy whenever I wear clothes that were just watched. After buying this product, and washing a huge load of clothes, I noticed that I don't have that issue anymore. I am happy with my purchase. I just wish the bottle was bigger!! I will definitely need to be ordering more soon

reviews.reviewTitle: Not getting my laundry clean anymore.
reviews.reviewText: We used to use this detergent a few years ago without issue. My husband has an allergy to synthetic detergents and this being plant based was one he never reacted to. We decided to switch back to it recently but our laundry started to stink no matter how many times we washed them or which cycle used. We switch to a different detergent and the smell went away after one load. Not sure if this formula changed or what but it does not clean our laundry at all.
